PB-Galaga Architecture

Review the current system, conduct a gap analysis and plan the implementation tasks.

Architecture:
1. The game will run entirely in the browser/client.2. The game will use a 'Fixed time step with synchronization' engine.3. Game loop (engine) and game state should be decoupled from the renderer, so the game can be run and tested in a "headless" mode.4. The game state should be double buffered (current and previous) allowing for interpolation (rendering) to reduce lag. It is envisioned that Phaser (latest) will be used for rendering.5. All game object types should have their own test harness, that allows them to be run in an isolated instance of the game engine, state and render. These harnesses will have test menus that allow all game object modes and animations to be tested in isolation (both rendered and headless)6. The game should support one player or two player co-op modes
The codebase should be structured like so:
/engine (game loop, manager, menu systems)/objects (players ships, enemies, projectiles, power ups, bosses, asteroids etc)/objects/[object type]/sounds/*/objects/[object type]/animations/*/objects/[object type]/code/levels (metadata/code for arranging enemies, enemy flight paths and other level content such as background, foreground objects or effects)
Example objects are:
Player ships- thrusters - fire modes- power up modesEnemies - thrusters - fire modesProjectiles - rockets- misses- lasers- bullets- plasmaPower ups- health- shield- firepower - stealth 
Engineering strategy:
It is envisioned that we will take a 'test first' approach, meaning test scripts and AI must be able to advance the game loop and run tests to validate game state. The render pipeline should be as 'dumb' as possible.
Visual Design:
The game is intended to have a modern pixel-art arcade feel.
